text: Gents,
how do I update the global profile from a content?

Error: ValidationError: New layer violates key restrictions: keysCannotBeOverridden: global is already in layer 0
        keysCannotOverride: global would be overridden by layer 0
I tried with -f too but still getting the same error message
<@UA055BGUB> what version are you using? How are you updating?
I saved all I had modified from previous version and now trying to import in 3.8.0
drpcli contents create -f -F yaml slb_drpcontent.yaml
where slb_drpcontent.yaml is a bundle of everything
if I renew everywhere global with something else I can create the content but I would like to use is as global
You may have to update global instead of replacing it.  It's a unique profile.  <@U02DGQYK1> may have commentary
<@UA055BGUB> - global profile is special writable profile that can’t be inject as part of normal content injection.
<@U02DGQYK1> why we can't just update with the difference?
content layers don’t update other layers.
do I need to delete from yaml file and update manually the changes?
probably would be safer.
ok. will try that tomorrow
You can also unbundle the slb_drpcontent.yaml into the dr-provision digitalrebar directory.
will that update the global params too?
The bigger questions what are you trying to do?
anyway will check that tomorrow. thanks for the tips
I saved all the changes I did in previous version in a bundled yaml file. then I reinstalled the server and installed version 3.8.0. now I would like to apply all what I did in previous changes
So, that is a backup and restore
a kind of
to back-up: `drpcli contents show BackingStore --format=yaml > backup.yaml`
because I haven't saved anything just what I changed
To restore, change directory to the database directory of drp `/var/lib/dr-provision/digitalrebar`
`drpcli contents unbundle backup.yaml`
sounds a good idea. I will try tomorrow, as it is too late now
thanks a lot for the help
talk to you soon
